results.content: The course is nice, but not complete. There are better courses up there. I had a specific problem and the instructor suggested I could email the files for checking out the problem. I didn't receive any respond.

response.content:
Hello,

You provided a link that was not publicly available, so I suggested that you sent me the files by e-mail. Till this day, I have never received any e-mail from you, hence why I never had a chance to reply. I have tried to get in touch with you for a week now to try to assist you and have been polite and gone out of my way to try to fix the situation. Unfortunately you have not replied to any of my messages, so it seems like you insist on not resolving the issue. Unfortunately I cannot reply to an e-mail that I never received.

About the course not being done, that's true as of today, but I made this very clear, both in the promotional video as well as in bold text at the top of the course description.

I am happy that you thought the course was nice, but the rest I am unable to do anything about, unfortunately.

Best regards,
Bo Andersen
response.content_html:
Hello,

You provided a link that was not publicly available, so I suggested that you sent me the files by e-mail. Till this day, I have never received any e-mail from you, hence why I never had a chance to reply. I have tried to get in touch with you for a week now to try to assist you and have been polite and gone out of my way to try to fix the situation. Unfortunately you have not replied to any of my messages, so it seems like you insist on not resolving the issue. Unfortunately I cannot reply to an e-mail that I never received.

About the course not being done, that's true as of today, but I made this very clear, both in the promotional video as well as in bold text at the top of the course description.

I am happy that you thought the course was nice, but the rest I am unable to do anything about, unfortunately.

Best regards,
Bo Andersen

results.content:
I am a german and my english is okay, but not on native level, so for me it is really hard to understand the tutor sometimes, not only because of the accent, it is also the sound quality from his microphone. The two things together are the reason for 4.5 stars.

BUT: beside of this (i will use a headset from now on, so not really a problem) the course is really good and easy to understand. Especially because of the graphic support in the video, you can see what "pairs come together". 

I can absolute recommend the course!

response.content:
Hello Simon,

Thank you very much for your review. I do have a bit of accent, so my apologies for that. ;-) In regards to the microphone, I noticed that you are still in the early stages of the course. After recording the first two sections of the course, I purchased a fancy microphone, so hopefully you will notice a higher quality a bit later in the course. :-)

Best regards,
Bo Andersen
response.content_html:
Hello Simon,

Thank you very much for your review. I do have a bit of accent, so my apologies for that. ;-) In regards to the microphone, I noticed that you are still in the early stages of the course. After recording the first two sections of the course, I purchased a fancy microphone, so hopefully you will notice a higher quality a bit later in the course. :-)

Best regards,
Bo Andersen

results.content: Excellent course. Clear and detailed explanations. Covers a lot. Only complaint: the screen goes out of focus sometimes (especially in the animation section) and is very distracting.

response.content:
Hello Eric,

Thanks so much for your review! I am sorry to hear that you faced issues with the video. Unfortunately that is something that is out of my control. The video is recorded in 1080p and uploaded to Udemy in high quality, but unfortunately the video is compressed quite heavily before being published, resulting in loss of quality.

Thanks again.

Best regards,
Bo Andersen

Hello Eric,

Thanks so much for your review! I am sorry to hear that you faced issues with the video. Unfortunately that is something that is out of my control. Thanks again.

results.content:
I came in with already some knowledge of Vue.js but this course further strengthened my understanding of this framework. Bo did a great job of breaking up the logic of the tools that are available to use, and I liked how he provided github repos with branches separated by lectures.

The only thing I wish is that he did the same for the last lecture about Vuex. I would also love it if Bo updated this course with a section about Axios as well, since not all Vue developers use vue-resource.
results.content_html:
I came in with already some knowledge of Vue.js but this course further strengthened my understanding of this framework. Bo did a great job of breaking up the logic of the tools that are available to use, and I liked how he provided github repos with branches separated by lectures.

The only thing I wish is that he did the same for the last lecture about Vuex. I would also love it if Bo updated this course with a section about Axios as well, since not all Vue developers use vue-resource.

results.content: In the early lectures, you made it clear when it was time to do a challenge hands-on, and they were good challenges.  But later, it was not clear when to type or when to just watch.  I feel like I was just watching a bit too much because of this.  But, you were very good at explaining things to an intermediate programmer and I can always review a section when I am stuck on a concept in my app (probably related to vuex).  Well done!

results.content:
This is the most advanced Vue course on Udemy.  The author is most clearly an expert on the subject matter.  Many Udemy authors who produce content in Laravel, Vue, or PHP are of moderate to high intermediate skill; few are truly experts.

Bo is an expert on the subject of Vue and Vuex.  His teaching style is also excellent, being project-based as opposed to topic-based.  While he teaches topics, he integrates nearly all conceptual components into basic application examples.  Whereas sometimes even advanced course authors simply create visual representations of what can be read in the written documentation for the framework at hand, Bo does a great job of explaining the why in addition to the how.  

I hope that Bo produces more content; he is an excellent instructor.  10 stars.  

I own every course on Udemy that remotely touches Vue, Vuex, or Laravel.  230+ in my archive on Udemy.

Not a beginner's course but an excellent one nonetheless.  Highly recommended.

Best regards,
Bo Andersen

Bo is an expert on the subject of Vue and Vuex. His teaching style is also excellent, being project-based as opposed to topic-based. While he teaches topics, he integrates nearly all conceptual components into basic application examples. Whereas sometimes even advanced course authors simply create visual representations of what can be read in the written documentation for the framework at hand, Bo does a great job of explaining the why in addition to the how.

I hope that Bo produces more content; he is an excellent instructor. 10 stars.

results.content: I enjoyed the course fully. Just stubmbled on this courser and bought this course based on the reviews from other students. I am glad I found the reviews very true. Good learning experinece. Thanks a lot Bo Andersen.

results.content:
Very well structured and nicely-paced course. I learned a few shortcuts that have already proven themselves useful in my current Vue project. Including the Vuex section was a very welcome addition.

I do think that adding very small examples on aspects like preprocessor support or going to a bit more depth into some Vue best practices would've been excellent, although admittedly there's quite a lot of depth already so it's not completely necessary.

Overall I highly recommend this course for developers of all levels.

results.content: At first I thought the pace was really slow, then I realised that this course is indeed intended for the very beginners. results.content:
First 1/2 is very clear, to the point, nothing is misleading, contradictory or otherwise confusing.   Smooth, thoughtful explanation.   Very good pace for either a beginner or as a senior dev that wants to enjoy a quite understanding of this tech.  This is, of course, assuming you know something about about web development as it's been done for some time.

If you are like me, professional coding before the big JS explosion, loading Vue on a page with <script> tags will feel nice and easy.   But, of course, we need to learn and use Webpack, don't we?   I found this course to be a good primer to single file Vuejs components and webpack.  

The rest of the course gets into ES6 JS.   If you get panicky looking at arrow functions, then beware.   Personally, I do.   So, as I was able to follow the 1st half easily, the second half is a challenge.   But I see this is a value.  The course is no picnic.   You stand to learn.

results.content: Lot's and lot's of information! So much information that I'm probably only retaining 60% of what's being taught. The instructor knows what he's doing, there's no question about that. The down side is that he has a dead-pan voice; very robotic. I couldn't help but laugh in the beginning of this tutorial...he asks, 'are you excited to get started?'. It's funny because of his robotic way of talking. As a result, it's hard to stay engaged with the lessons that are longer than 5 min.

response.content:
Hello Chris,

Thank you for your review.

I think you'd be surprised just how difficult it is to communicate enthusiasm through a microphone. It's well known that any enthusiasm is reduce by at least 50% when speaking into a microphone, and the same is the case when there is no camera around. And let's just say that things don't get better when you are dealing with a software developer whose mother tongue is another language (a robotic language, actually). :-) I actually did my best to speak enthusiastically into the microphone, but I guess it got lost in some bytes somewhere... ;-)

I feel like this course has so much great information packed into it that for $10, it's worth a higher rating. Sorry that you didn't enjoy my robo-accent, but I am glad that you liked the content anyways. :-)

Best regards,
Bo Andersen
response.content_html:
Hello Chris,

Thank you for your review.

I think you'd be surprised just how difficult it is to communicate enthusiasm through a microphone. It's well known that any enthusiasm is reduce by at least 50% when speaking into a microphone, and the same is the case when there is no camera around. And let's just say that things don't get better when you are dealing with a software developer whose mother tongue is another language (a robotic language, actually). :-) I actually did my best to speak enthusiastically into the microphone, but I guess it got lost in some bytes somewhere... ;-)

I feel like this course has so much great information packed into it that for $10, it's worth a higher rating. Sorry that you didn't enjoy my robo-accent, but I am glad that you liked the content anyways. :-)

Best regards,
Bo Andersen

response.content:
Hello Luigi,

While the first section uses JSFiddle, this gives you an understanding of how Vue.js works, and the concept is exactly the same as with applications built using Vue CLI. Of course applications shouldn't be written using JSFiddle, so that is just an easy way to get started; diving straight into real world applications can be quite confusing for a lot of people. The remaining 12 hours of the course does not use JSFiddle, and uses real world projects.

Best regards,
Bo Andersen
response.content_html:
Hello Luigi,

While the first section uses JSFiddle, this gives you an understanding of how Vue.js works, and the concept is exactly the same as with applications built using Vue CLI. Of course applications shouldn't be written using JSFiddle, so that is just an easy way to get started; diving straight into real world applications can be quite confusing for a lot of people. The remaining 12 hours of the course does not use JSFiddle, and uses real world projects.

Best regards,
Bo Andersen
